quest.name: Choices and Paths
journal: Widargelt remains in the depths of despair.

Widargelt still needs time to process his recent defeat and the revelations about his past. But in spite of his own woes, he manages to show concern for his disciples, and asks that you speak with them and lift their spirits.

You look in on D'zentsa and O'tchakha, who in turn express their concern for their master. Uncertain what to do, they decide to turn to the ever-insightful Erik. While they keep an eye on the despairing Widargelt, they bid you fetch the professor from Rhalgr's Reach, home of the Resistance, where he is making his inquiries.

You find Erik just as he finishes asking Resistance soldiers about the mysterious Theobald. After sharing with you his findings, he agrees to accompany you back to Ala Gannha to have a stern word with Widargelt.

Widargelt has largely come to terms with his defeat; rather, the revelation of his true identity as the nephew of the King of Ruin has made him question his fitness to revive the Fist of Rhalgr. Through a tale about his departed son, Erik teaches Widargelt that a man is defined not by his blood, but by the choices he makes. His vigor and purpose thus restored, Widargelt turns his attention to what must be done. He reveals his suspicion that Theobald is in fact someone known to him: a brother from the Temple of the Fist named Adri, whom he had long believed dead. If it comes to it, Widargelt stands ready to strike him down, and he asks that you train him and his disciples in the way of the pugilist, that they might defeat the Corpse Brigade. Make your way to the old training grounds and begin their training.

Widargelt and his disciples prove eager students, and they quickly grasp the fundamentals of pugilism. As you train, a man named Hewerald arrives bearing the news that Erik has made a momentous discovery pertaining to Theobald. While your students continue their training, you decide to follow the messenger to East End, where the professor awaits.

The meeting with Erik turns out to be a trap, and you are forced to defend yourself. As you gain the upper hand, however, the battle transforms into a hostage situation. Just when it seems you must surrender, Widargelt and his disciples come to the rescue, having used their newfound fighting skills to overwhelm the sentries posted around the forest.
With the enemy thus routed, you may turn your attention to the liberated Erik.
Erik is well considering his ordeal, and your friends set out for Ala Gannha. Join them back at the village and speak with Widargelt to learn of his plans.

Widargelt declares his intent to challenge Theobald and put an end to his tyrannical ambitions. As your brother monk prepares for the encounter, see to it that you hone your own fists and feet.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Erik at Rhalgr's Reach.
Speak with Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Widargelt at Gyr Kehim.
Speak with Hewerald in East End.
Speak with Widargelt in Ala Gannha.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It's you again, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My new pupils. They have lost faith in me. And so I have lost them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But perhaps it is just as well. For I am unfit to teach. I am the mad king's kin. It would be an affront.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive me... I should not burden you. But to you, I feel I can speak my heart. Reveal things I would not to others. Not even my closest disciples. Speaking of whom...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa and O'tchakha. Their bodies may have healed. But their pride will yet be raw. They would be heartened for your visit.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. How good of you to come and see us.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Both Zentsa and I are well now, never you fear. 'Tis Master Widargelt that worries us. He will not soon recover from the emotional blow.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Given all that's happened, you can hardly blame him. <sigh> We were supposed to support Master, but in the end we were just dead weight...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Lessons have been suspended since the incident. Not that it matters, though─the villagers have ceased attending. It is a big setback to our mission, but the biggest setback of all is Master's melancholy.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Professor Erik would know what to do, I'd wager. Let's go and consult him. ...But, ugh, I don't want to leave Master by himself.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Nor do I. Forename, might we trouble you to find the professor and bring him back?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I believe he took his investigation of the man named Theobald to the Resistance, at Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have not the right to revive the Fist...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: If only I was stronger, dammit!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you come at a good time. I've just finished inquiring after our friend, His Aspiring Majesty Theobald, and you are doubtless eager to hear my findings. Ahem!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: By all accounts, 'twas but recently that the man surfaced. None can quite say whence he came, but no sooner did he appear than he declared himself Theodoric's heir and proceeded to recruit people to his cause.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But the prevailing sentiment around the fellow is one of uncertainty. It should come as no surprise, but folk are not exactly keen on the Griffin's return. And lest we forget, few have fond memories of the King of Ruin's reign, nor do they have any reason to love his heir.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: That is all. Now then, what brings you here?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Still sulking into his cyclas, you say? <sigh> Utterly hopeless...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Very well, I shall go and slap some sense into the fool. Come, Forename.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: This won't do. I need to get stronger, else I can't protect anyone. Else I can't protect...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Rain, hail, or shine, Master Widargelt has never skipped training. It must be a veritable storm inside.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt. A thrashing though it was, how long will you let a single defeat keep you down? As I hear it, you've been neglecting your training─haven't so much as lifted a finger. You would let all that muscle go to fat?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Defeat is painful. This is true. But I am no stranger to its sting. In time, the sensation fades. But this... It is no mere sensation. It is my very existence.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The man who destroyed the Fist of Rhalgr. His blood courses through my veins. That I should seek to revive the order... It is an affront to the dead. I have not the right.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: ...So that is the way of it. I will tell you a story. I once had a son. In many ways he took after me, and 'twas my hope that he would one day follow in my footsteps.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But the boy had grander dreams. Wanting to change the world, he took off and joined the Resistance. And then he died.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text:
His unit was hopelessly surrounded by imperial forces. In order to save his comrades, he swept up a sack of explosives and─
...But the details are irrelevant.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: For long years I lived with regret. If only my son had walked the path of science, I lamented, he might still be here.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But eventually I came to a realization: it was his choice to make, and make it he did. He chose to be a soldier and died a hero. In acknowledging this, I was able to attain a semblance of peace.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: We are defined not by our blood, Widargelt, but by our choices. So your uncle is the mad king. What of it? You are not him. You are you, by whatever name, and there is no limit to what path you may walk. That path may be fraught with hardship, but you mustn't give up.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Behold the soldiers of the Resistance. Even now, they fight tirelessly against the might of the Empire, ever ready to render up their lives for their cause.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Behold the soldiers of the Resistance. Even after their great victory, they continue their vigil, ever ready to render up their lives for their cause.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: These men and women bear a great burden, one beneath which they could buckle at any moment. Yet they stand firm to the very last. I used to wonder, why do they not give up? My son taught me the answer: they believe that the moment you give up on something is the moment you lose it.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: When first we met, you were hells-bent on retribution. Mule-headed though you were, you came to see the folly of your path. But there comes a time when a man must fight. For you, that time is now.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: So find your inner mule, Widargelt, and fight. Fight for that which you believe in.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are right, Professor. I see now what is truly important. Theobald desires absolute rule. If he has his way, the people will suffer. This cannot be borne. It flies in the face of the new Fist.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I would restore hope to the people. But to do this, I must transcend him. I will become stronger. And I will protect that which I hold dear.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear it. Suffice it to say I shall aid in whatever way I can.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Something else has been bothering me, Professor. About Theobald. His polearm techniques are distinct. I have seen them before. But when? Where?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: 'Twas a long time ago. When the Temple of the Fist still stood.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <gasp> No... It couldn't possibly be...Adri?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Who is this Adri?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A brother at the Temple of the Fist. And the closest thing I had to family. I had thought him dead. Slain when the temple was razed.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But now you believe that he may still be alive, and is the one who seeks to prevent your reviving the Fist of Rhalgr?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Let us confront him and uncover the truth.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If it comes to it, could you strike him down?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I looked upon Adri as a true brother. I do not wish for us to fight.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I looked upon Adri as a true brother. I do not wish for it to end that way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But neither can I yield in my purpose. I seek to restore hope to the people. Adri seeks to deprive them of it. If we must stand opposed...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Then I stand ready to strike him down!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But remember, Adri is not alone. He has rallied the Corpse Brigade to his cause, and against them the Fist of Rhalgr is ineffectual. How do you intend to overcome this disadvantage?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If our fighting style will not serve, we will master another. One that is free and unshackled by form.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, I would ask a favor of you. All you learned as a pugilist, we would learn also. Will you teach us?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Reckon you can keep up?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's going to be tough.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Give us your worst, sisterbrother! We will take it all in our stride!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If you are ready, I would begin at once. Let us train at Gyr Kehim. As the monks of old once did. I shall summon the girls. Pray meet us there.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Well, it would seem that the storm has blown over. With that, I shall return to Ul'dah to tend to a task of mine own. I trust you will see to the rest here.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Theobald leads the Corpse Brigade. Soldiers trained to suppress the Fist of Rhalgr. Against them, our style is ineffective.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If we are to triumph, we must broaden our horizons. And Forename will help us.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Alright! Let's do it!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I shall give it my all!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You well know how we fight. Our strengths and our weaknesses. Tell us what we must improve. From the eyes of a pugilist.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What do they need to improve?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Speed.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Endurance.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Strength.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see... Above all, a pugilist is swift. For each blow he receives, he delivers a dozen.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! Our combinations must be seamless! Ten thousand Bootshines!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see... Beside the pugilist, we want for endurance. No number of blows must stop us.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! Our endurance must be unyielding! Steel Peak ten thousand times!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see... Beside the pugilist, we want for power. Every blow must be telling.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! Our strikes must be harder than stone! Arm of the Destroyer for ten hours!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <pant> So this is how you trained... <pant> It is eye-opening...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But it is not enough. We must learn more. Or we cannot defeat the enemy. Please, Forename! Teach us more!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So our speed is yet lacking? Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So our endurance is yet lacking? Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So our power is yet lacking? Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <huff> Such brutal training... <gasp> Small wonder you are strong...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But we are not finished yet! Again, Forename!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: (-???-)Pray forgive me my interruption. My name is Hewerald, and I am come at Professor Erik's behest.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The professor? Has something happened?

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Nothing untoward, I assure you. He has made a momentous discovery pertaining to the man called Theobald.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Truly!? We must go to him at once!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Ah, beg your pardons, but the professor bade me bring MistressMaster Forename alone. He believes that you and the ladies should focus upon your training first and foremost.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I suppose he is right. Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Go on, sisterbrother. You have taught us all we need to know. All that remains is to practice. Make it second nature.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: My thanks for your understanding. Then without further ado, please follow me.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: No way I'm gettin' thrashed like that again. I'm gonna train harder than I've ever trained before!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: It wouldn't do to always rely on you and Master Widargelt. Nay, we must grow strong and become able to fend for ourselves.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Not far now. The professor awaits beyond.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Hehehehe...

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Hahahaha! I can't believe you fell for it!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Ah, but to be fair, I spoke no lies. The professor did call for you.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: “Help me, Forename,” he said! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Can't have you meddling no more, see?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You're strong, I'll give you that. But how do you like these odds?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'll put you in your place!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The hells you all waiting for!? Finish herhim!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Stubborn bastard... We'll just have to try something different.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Surrender now or he's a dead man!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Can't even finish a fight you started!? Cravens, the whole lot of you!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Call me what you will, but no one stands between the king and his throne!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You were slow to return. So we followed. It was right that we did.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thank Rhalgr we were not too late.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: You... How the hells did you get past the sentries?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We trampled right over them, how else?

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Damn it... Your ilk was supposed to be easy pickings...

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: The day's yours, but it isn't over. Mark my words.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Worry not about us, sisterbrother. Go to the professor.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: <pant> And there I thought you were a demon in battle...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: The training is arduous, but we will persevere─for Master Widargelt.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. I was on my way back from Ul'dah when they set upon me, and none too gently, the bloody brutes.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am sorry, Professor. It is my fault. You were put in danger because of me.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Haven't you learned anything, you dolt? I am part of this cause of my own volition. For better or worse, I alone bear responsibility for my actions. At any rate, I have done what I needed to do, and you may resume training safe in that knowledge.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Begging your pardons, but may I suggest we leave this place? The enemy may still be lurking nearby.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The wisest thing said all day. Come, let us return to Ala Gannha.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We are stronger thanks to your teachings. Strong enough to face the Corpse Brigade.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We're still nowhere near your level, but I reckon we've improved some!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: <pant> From the training...to our rushing here...to the battle itself... <pant> It has been a day...of exertion...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I thank you again, Forename. For your teachings. Owing to them, we could save the professor.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He sustained some injuries. But for a blessing, they are minor. The village healer tends to him.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: When he is recovered, I mean to challenge Theobald. For that day, I will train hard. And I will put an end to his tyrannical ambitions. Witness me, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We got the better of the Corpse Brigade this time, and it's all thanks to you, Forename. You and your...ungh...brutal training.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Your lessons have allowed us to transcend the limits of our style, Forename. All you have taught us, we shall practice without cease.
